content: What do people think of puttingcompact_opens in a new file topology.sets.compact_opens? I foresee I will have to develop the API to the extent of docs#topological_space.opens, so it might be worth having its own file. Then we can rename topology.opens to topology.sets.opens and topology.compacts to topology.sets.compacts (and maybe split it?).
@Ashvni Narayanan has been developing the theory of clopens within a compact Hausdorff space and it occurs to me that this is the same as compact_opens in this context.
Oh, I was actually about to define clopens and clopen_upsets soon. Would be nice to coordinate.
Are they using the bundled type or the unbundled predicate? I'm interested in the former (and for a fact can write the API I need in under an hour).
We had a discussion about whether to bundle or not, and she decided not to e.g. see here
Just to make sure: you know about docs#is_clopen, right?
Are you talking to me? Yes, I do. I need the bundled type to make it into a lattice.

Oh this must be what Ashvni is using. OK I remember now: the discussion was about whether to bundle it; I think that in a previous version of her work she had bundled it but then decided she didn't need the bundled type.
May I :ping_pong: ?
Hi @Yaël Dillies ! Sorry for the late response. As @Kevin Buzzard mentioned, I did make a bundled version, but it made life much more difficult for me. I am happy to talk more about it :)
